Space Technology Conference Central Eurasia (STC) 2026

21 April 2026 – 22 April 2026

Dialogue Events Ltd. (United Kingdom) Tashkent, Uzbekistan

The Space Technology Conference (STC) Central Eurasia 2026 will be held on April 21–22, 2026, in Uzbekistan, showcasing the region’s fastest-growing aerospace ecosystem. This pivotal event assembles government leaders, engineers, investors, and entrepreneurs from Central Eurasia and beyond to foster collaboration, advance space technology, and accelerate economic development. If you seek to influence future policies, explore new markets, and engage with groundbreaking technologies, STC 2026 provides a dynamic platform for those ambitions.

Uzbekistan Emerges as a Space Technology Epicenter

By hosting STC 2026, Uzbekistan reinforces its ambitions to become a major space technology hub in Central Eurasia. The conference highlights the strategic importance of the region in satellite communications, earth observation, and space applications that impact climate, agriculture, and communications. Moreover, this event provides an exceptional forum for national agencies, private companies, and research organizations to showcase their innovations and forge lasting partnerships. This focus underlines Uzbekistan’s commitment to fostering a collaborative ecosystem capable of sustaining rapid technological progress.

Rich Program Featuring Industry Leaders and Innovators

Over two days, attendees will experience a comprehensive agenda filled with keynote presentations, panel discussions, and hands-on workshops featuring top specialists in space science, policy, and commercial ventures. Topics include sustainable space governance, satellite data applications for socioeconomic development, public-private partnerships, and emerging tech such as nanosatellites and AI. Besides promoting knowledge exchange, the program actively encourages startups and innovators to connect with potential investors and collaborators, fueling the region’s entrepreneurial spirit.

Networking Events Driving Investment and Partnerships

STC 2026 goes beyond speeches by offering curated networking sessions, B2B matchmaking, and live demonstrations that enable direct engagement between attendees. These activities promote strategic alliances, facilitate investment deals, and accelerate technology commercialization. The conference’s lively atmosphere empowers participants to build actionable relationships that can transform ideas into real-world aerospace solutions. Consequently, the event plays a crucial role in positioning Central Eurasia competitively within the global space economy.

Why Attend STC Central Eurasia 2026 ?

Industry professionals, policymakers, and financiers attending STC will gain exclusive regional insights, emerging technology previews, and opportunities to impact evolving space regulations. Additionally, the conference’s location in Uzbekistan offers a gateway to Central Asia’s untapped markets and burgeoning aerospace initiatives. Attendance ensures access to critical knowledge, valuable networks, and strategic projects that will define the region’s space sector over the coming decades. Thus, STC 2026 represents an essential event for anyone invested in aerospace growth and innovation.

Embark on the Future at STC Central Eurasia 2026

In conclusion, the Space Technology Conference Central Eurasia 2026 stands as a landmark event uniting diverse stakeholders dedicated to transforming space technology into regional economic and social progress. By participating in this vibrant, forward-looking forum, attendees can drive meaningful collaborations, uncover new opportunities, and shape Central Eurasia’s place on the global aerospace stage. Mark your calendar for April 21–22, 2026, and prepare to engage with the future at Uzbekistan’s premier aerospace gathering.

Impact Orbit Creative Group

Impact Orbit Creative Group is a multi-disciplinary consultancy and innovation hub focused on driving sustainable growth, digital transformation, and impact-led strategies in the space and technology sectors. We partner with organisations and startups worldwide to deliver strategic guidance, communications expertise, and frameworks for responsible innovation.
